dc:title: Spring Appeal - April 1966
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Semi-annual appeal for funds. She says the destitute they take in become part of the Catholic Worker family until they die. Says the Lord asks, "Do you mean what you say when you repeat my words, 'All men are brothers'?"
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 836 1966-04-01 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
